title: Rename project from kitty-rc-proto-rs to kitty_rc
description: Rename the Rust project from kitty-rc-proto-rs to kitty_rc for better naming and shorter crate name
design:
Need to rename:
1. Crate name in Cargo.toml
2. Module exports in lib.rs
3. Update any imports in binaries
4. Update documentation references

This is a straightforward rename operation.
acceptance_criteria:
- Crate renamed to kitty_rc in Cargo.toml
- All imports updated to use kitty_rc
- Binaries use new crate name
- All tests pass after rename
- Commit created with descriptive message

title: Integrate pubkey.db with KittyBuilder
description: Modify KittyBuilder to automatically query kitty public key database for a public key when password is provided but no explicit public key is set. This enables seamless password authentication for standalone clients.
notes:
Implementation complete! Added automatic public key database query to KittyBuilder.

✅ Changes implemented:
- Added PublicKeyDatabaseError variant to EncryptionError enum for database errors
- Added extract_pid_from_socket() helper function extracts PID from socket paths
  Handles formats: /tmp/kitty-12345.sock, /run/user/1000/kitty/kitty-12345.sock
- Added query_public_key_database() function to call kitty-pubkey-db get command
- Modified KittyBuilder::connect() to auto-query database when:
  * Password is provided
  * No explicit public_key() is set
  * KITTY_PUBLIC_KEY environment variable is not set
  * Socket path contains extractable PID
- Added comprehensive tests for PID extraction (4 new tests)
- Updated README.md with automatic database query documentation

✅ All tests passing (155 total)
✅ Enables seamless password authentication for standalone clients
✅ Automatic fallback to existing behavior if database query fails

Ticket complete and ready for use.
close_reason: Implementation complete. Added automatic public key database query to KittyBuilder. Extracts PID from socket path and queries kitty-pubkey-db when password is provided without explicit public_key or KITTY_PUBLIC_KEY. All tests passing (155 total). README updated with automatic database query documentation.

title: Implement serde structs for kitty response data
description: Define serde-deserializable structs for kitty protocol responses (ProcessInfo, WindowInfo, TabInfo, OsInstance) in appropriate command modules

title: Command Modules: Tab and Layout management APIs
description: Implement tab and layout management command APIs including focus-tab, set-tab-title, close-tab, goto-layout, set-enabled-layouts commands
design:
Tab management:
- focus-tab: Focus specific tab by match criteria
- set-tab-title: Change tab title
- close-tab: Close tabs with match/self/ignore_no_match options

Layout management:
- goto-layout: Switch layout in specific tab
- set-enabled-layouts: Configure available layouts
- last-used-layout: Revert to previous layout

All commands should support optional match criteria.
acceptance_criteria:
- All tab management commands implemented
- All layout management commands implemented
- Builder pattern for command options
- Match criteria support
- Integration with protocol and transport layers
- Unit tests for each command type

title: Add remaining tab management commands
description: Add detach-tab command to tab.rs module for detaching tabs to different OS windows
design:
Add DetachTabCommand with fields:
- match (default: None): Which tab to detach
- target_tab (default: None): Which tab to move the detached tab to the OS window it is run in
- self (default: False): Whether to detach the tab of the window the command is run in

Integrate with existing tab.rs module structure.
acceptance_criteria:
- DetachTabCommand implemented
- Builder pattern with match, target_tab, self options
- Integration with KittyMessage
- Unit tests for all options
- 53 total tests passing

title: Implement kitty public key database
description: Implement the public key database system as described in doc/PLAN-pubkey-db.md. This enables standalone clients to use password authentication by storing and retrieving kitty's public keys.
notes:
Implementation complete! Fixed format string error using raw strings and brace escaping.

✅ All subcommands implemented and working:
  - init: Initialize database and show shell integration example
  - add: Add public key entry (PID and pubkey required, window-id optional)
  - cleanup: Remove entries for dead PIDs (daily via epoch file)
  - get: Retrieve public key by PID

✅ Storage in XDG state directory (~/.local/state/kitty/pubkey.tsv)
✅ TSV format: PID\tWINDOW_ID\tPUBLIC_KEY\tTIMESTAMP
✅ Daily cleanup tracking via pubkey-check.epoch
✅ Process running check via /proc/{pid} on Unix
✅ All tests passing (149 total)
✅ Binary fully functional and tested

Shell integration example output works correctly with proper escaping.

Implementation complete and ready for use.
close_reason: Implementation complete. All subcommands (init, add, cleanup, get) working with proper TSV database storage in XDG state directory. Format string error fixed using raw strings and brace escaping. All 149 tests passing. Binary fully functional and tested.

title: Implement style and appearance commands
description: Create style.rs module with set-background-opacity, set-background-image, set-colors, set-font-size, set-spacing, set-tab-color, get-colors commands
design:
Create new style.rs module with commands:
- set-background-opacity: Set opacity with required opacity parameter (0-1) and match_window/match_tab/all/toggle options
- set-background-image: Set background image with required data (chunked base64 PNG) and match/layout/all/configured options
- set-colors: Set colors with required colors mapping and match_window/match_tab/all/configured/reset options
- set-font-size: Set font size with required size parameter and all/increment_op options
- set-spacing: Set spacing with required settings object and match_window/match_tab/all/configured options
- set-tab-color: Set tab color with required colors mapping and match/self options
- get-colors: Get colors with match option and configured boolean

set-background-image and set-window-logo use streaming for large data.
acceptance_criteria:
- style.rs module created
- All 6 commands implemented
- Builder patterns for each command
- Streaming support for set-background-image
- Integration with KittyMessage
- Comprehensive unit tests
- Updated mod.rs to export style commands
- set-tab-color in both style.rs and referenced from tab commands

title: Create action builders for kitty actions
description:
Create builder pattern for kitty actions mapped in kitty.conf

Actions are mappable keyboard/mouse actions in kitty. Need to create action builders following the same pattern as command builders.

Categories to implement:
- src/actions/session.rs - Session actions (quit, etc.)
- src/actions/tab.rs - Tab management (new_tab, goto_tab, etc.)
- src/actions/window.rs - Window management (new_window, focus_window, etc.)
- src/actions/clipboard.rs - Copy/paste actions
- src/actions/debug.rs - Debug actions
- src/actions/layout.rs - Layout actions (goto_layout, toggle_layout, etc.)
- src/actions/mark.rs - Mark actions (create_marker, scroll_to_mark, etc.)
- src/actions/misc.rs - Miscellaneous actions (send_key, send_text, kitten, launch, etc.)
- src/actions/mouse.rs - Mouse actions
- src/actions/scroll.rs - Scrolling actions (scroll_line_up, scroll_page_down, etc.)

Actions reference: https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/actions/

Each action should:
- Have builder pattern with fluent API
- Accept relevant parameters
- Build to a String that can be used in kitty.conf map directives
- Have unit tests
- Update src/actions/mod.rs to export all actions

title: Add encryption config parameters
description: Add encryption parameters to global config for connecting to kitty with encrypted sockets

title: Add missing fields to WindowInfo, TabInfo, and OsInstance structs
description: WindowInfo, TabInfo, and OsInstance structs are missing ~30 fields that kitty actually returns. Update all three structs to capture complete response data from kitty's ls command

title: Implement process management commands
description: Create process.rs module with run, kitten, launch, env, set-user-vars, load-config, resize-os-window, disable-ligatures, signal-child commands
design:
Create new process.rs module with commands:
- run: Run command with data/cmdline/env/allow_remote_control/remote_control_password
- kitten: Run kitten with args/match options
- launch: Launch with args/window_title/cwd/env/var/tab_title/type/keep_focus/copy_colors/copy_cmdline/copy_env/hold/location/allow_remote_control/remote_control_password/stdin_source/stdin_add_formatting/stdin_add_line_wrap_markers/spacing/marker/logo/logo_position/logo_alpha/self/os_window_title/os_window_name/os_window_class/os_window_state/color/watcher/bias options
- env: Set environment variables with env dictionary
- set-user-vars: Set user variables with var list and match
- load-config: Load config with paths/override/ignore_overrides
- resize-os-window: Resize OS window with match/self/incremental/action/unit/width/height
- disable-ligatures: Disable ligatures with strategy/match_window/match_tab/all options
- signal-child: Send signals with signals required parameter and match option

Launch is very complex with many options. Run supports streaming.
acceptance_criteria:
- process.rs module created
- All 8 commands implemented
- Builder patterns for each command
- Launch command with all complex options
- Streaming support for run command
- Integration with KittyMessage
- Comprehensive unit tests
- Updated mod.rs to export process commands

title: Async and Streaming support for kitty protocol
description: Implement async request handling and streaming chunk support for commands that require asynchronous communication or large data payloads
design:
Async requests:
- Generate random unique IDs for async commands
- Handle async responses that arrive after delay
- Cancel async requests via cancel_async field

Streaming:
- Split large requests into chunks (max 4096 bytes)
- Include stream=true and stream_id in each chunk
- Send empty chunk to indicate end of data
- Support for stdin streaming and image uploads

Commands needing async: select-window, kitten Commands needing streaming: run, set-background-image, set-window-logo
acceptance_criteria:
- Async command handling with unique IDs
- Async request cancellation support
- Streaming chunk implementation
- Proper stream_id management across chunks
- End-of-data handling
- Integration with existing command types
- Unit tests for async and streaming scenarios

title: Comprehensive Error Handling for kitty-rc-proto
description: Implement robust error handling for protocol errors, connection errors, and command execution errors throughout the library
design:
Error types:
- ProtocolError: Malformed messages, invalid JSON, envelope parsing failures
- ConnectionError: Socket connection issues, timeouts, disconnects
- CommandError: Invalid command fields, execution failures, kitty error responses
- EncryptionError: Encryption/decryption failures (future)

Use thiserror for derive macros and helpful error messages. Include context and source errors where appropriate.
acceptance_criteria:
- Custom error types defined
- thiserror derive implementations
- Helpful error messages with context
- Error conversion chain preserved
- Documentation of error conditions
- Unit tests for error paths
- Integration tests verify error handling

title: Transport Layer: Unix domain socket communication
description: Implement async Unix domain socket transport layer for communicating with kitty terminal emulator through the socket file at $(pwd)/kitty.socket
design:
Use tokio for async I/O:
- UnixStream connection to kitty.socket
- Async read/write operations
- Connection pooling and reuse
- Timeout handling
- Graceful connection shutdown

The transport layer should be generic and not depend on specific command types.
acceptance_criteria:
- Connects to Unix domain socket at specified path
- Sends protocol messages asynchronously
- Receives responses asynchronously
- Implements connection pooling for multiple commands
- Handles connection errors gracefully
- Unit tests with mock socket

title: Add global config for kitty socket
description: Implement global configuration support for setting the kitty socket path

title: List windows binary implementation
description: Existing list_windows binary implementation that should be integrated into the new CLI structure

title: Protocol Layer: Message framing and JSON handling
description: Implement the core protocol layer for kitty remote control protocol. Handle message framing with escape sequences (0x1bP@kitty-cmd<JSON>0x1b\) and construct/parse JSON payloads.
design:
The protocol requires wrapping JSON commands in escape sequences:
- Prefix: 0x1bP@kitty-cmd
- JSON object with cmd, version, optional fields (no_response, kitty_window_id, payload)
- Suffix: 0x1b\

Response format needs parsing to extract JSON from the envelope.

Design a CommandBuilder struct with fluent API for constructing commands.
acceptance_criteria:
- CommandBuilder can construct valid protocol messages
- Messages properly framed with escape sequences
- Response parser extracts JSON from kitty responses
- Handles all standard command fields (cmd, version, no_response, kitty_window_id, payload)
- Unit tests for framing and parsing

title: Add remaining window management commands
description: Add focus-window, select-window, new-window, detach-window, set-window-title, set-window-logo, get-text, scroll-window, create-marker, remove-marker commands to window.rs
design:
Add commands to window.rs:
- focus-window: Focus specific window with match spec
- select-window: Async window selection with title/exclude_active/reactivate_prev_tab
- new-window: Create window with args/title/cwd/keep_focus/window_type/new_tab/tab_title
- detach-window: Detach window with match/target_tab/self/stay_in_tab options
- set-window-title: Set title with match/temporary options
- set-window-logo: Set logo with data/position/alpha/match/self options
- get-text: Extract text with match/extent/ansi/cursor/wrap_markers/clear_selection/self
- scroll-window: Scroll with amount required parameter
- create-marker: Create marker with match/self/marker_spec options
- remove-marker: Remove marker with match/self options

Select-window needs async support with unique ID generation.
acceptance_criteria:
- All 10 window commands implemented
- Builder pattern for each command
- Async support for select-window
- Integration with KittyMessage
- Comprehensive unit tests
- Total tests passing increased significantly

title: Add active-window subcommand
description: Add active-window subcommand with aliases 'active' and 'a' to display the currently active window

title: Use pubkey.db in KittyBuilder
description: Add a `public_key` method to KittyBuilder that allows users to explicitly provide a public key string for encryption. This provides an alternative to relying on KITTY_PUBLIC_KEY environment variable.
notes:
Implementation complete! Added public_key() method to KittyBuilder.

✅ Changes implemented:
- Added public_key field to KittyBuilder struct (Option<String>)
- Added public_key() builder method accepting any Into<String>
- Added Encryptor::new_with_public_key() method accepting optional public key
- Added helper methods: parse_public_key() and bytes_to_public_key()
- Updated KittyBuilder::connect() to pass public_key to Encryptor
- Added comprehensive tests (4 new tests for public_key functionality)
- Updated README.md with examples for standalone client password auth

✅ All tests passing (153 total)
✅ API provides alternative to KITTY_PUBLIC_KEY environment variable
✅ Enables explicit public key specification for standalone clients

Ticket complete and ready for use.
close_reason: Implementation complete. Added public_key() method to KittyBuilder with Encryptor::new_with_public_key() support. All tests passing (153 total). README updated with examples for standalone client password auth. Enables explicit public key specification as alternative to KITTY_PUBLIC_KEY environment variable.

title: Add goto subcommand
description: Add goto subcommand with alias 'g' to switch focus to a specific window

title: Make list-windows a subcommand
description: Implement list-windows as a subcommand of the kitty-rc CLI utility

title: Create kitty-rc general CLI utility
description: Create a general `kitty-rc` CLI utility that provides a command-line interface for kitty remote control operations

title: Update kitty protocol version to 0.43.1
description: Current kitty version is 0.43.1, but the code is using protocol version 0.14.2. Need to update the version in src/command.rs

title: Revise commands to output serde structs
description: Update command implementations to use serde response structs instead of manual JSON parsing

title: Command Modules: Window management APIs
description: Implement window management command APIs including ls, send-text, send-key, close-window, resize-window commands
design:
Group related commands into modules:
- ls: List windows with optional match/self filters
- send-text: Send text data to windows (plain text or base64)
- send-key: Send key sequences to windows
- close-window: Close windows with match/self/ignore_no_match options
- resize-window: Resize windows incrementally or reset

Each command should have a builder pattern for options and validation.
acceptance_criteria:
- All window management commands implemented
- Builder pattern for command options
- Validation of required fields
- Integration with protocol and transport layers
- Unit tests for each command type
- Documentation examples for common use cases

title: Command line interface for kitty-rc
description: Build a comprehensive CLI utility for kitty remote control with multiple subcommands for window management and configuration

title: Implement Action command (complex command)
description: Implement the action command which executes arbitrary kitty actions with arguments. This is a complex command that requires careful parsing and validation.
design:
The action command has the following fields:
- action (required): The action to perform, of the form: action [optional args…]
- match_window (optional): Window to run the action on
- self (default: False): Whether to use the window this command is run in as the active window

This command is complex because:
1. Actions can have variable arguments
2. Action syntax needs validation
3. Need to support various kitty actions

Should create a helper module for action parsing and validation.
acceptance_criteria:
- ActionCommand builder with fluent API
- Action string parsing and validation
- Match window support
- Self flag support
- Comprehensive unit tests for various action formats
- Documentation of supported actions

title: Add watch subcommand
description: Add watch subcommand with alias 'w' that continuously prints the active window name and id
